title: mirek92
author: mirek92
content: Hello, If I have some code and I can deploy it in remix.ethereum.org, does it means that I can create identical second one on Ethereum network?Or are there typically some thing which I must change?Thank you

comments.author: prosperoustop
comments.body: what code do you mean? If you are mean contract address, tokens for all chains have the same contract address!

comments.author: kryptocanon
comments.body: If contract address is what you're talking about here, then I'm happy to be of help by telling you NO!, it won't work. Two different network chain can never share the same contract address. They're of two different sources and they don't work together.

comments.author: piebeyb
comments.body: Quote from: mirek92 on May 16, 2022, 02:58:58 PMHello, If I have some code and I can deploy it in remix.ethereum.org, does it means that I can create identical second one on Ethereum network?Or are there typically some thing which I must change?Thank yousmart contracts with different networks such as ETH, BSC, Polygon and even others that support the same wallet address as 0xxxxx still have the same smart contract code, maybe you need to change the writing bep20 to erc20 in each of your smart contract codes

comments.author: leea-1334
comments.body: Same address always possible,,, I use the same addresses for ETH to make BSC but these are public keys, so just remember those are very very different from the token contracts.For example Floki has a different token contract on ETH than on BSC and I know other projects are similar.
